t: O*p Israel, return unto the Lord*s thy God; for thou hast fallen by thine iniquity.
Take*p with you words, and turn to the Lord:*s say unto him, Take away all iniquity, and receive us graciously: so will we render the calves of our lips.
Asshur*p shall not save us; we will not ride upon horses: neither will we say any more to the work of our hands, Ye are our gods: for in thee the fatherless findeth mercy.
I*p will heal their backsliding, I will love them freely: for mine anger is turned away from him.
I*p will be as the dew unto Israel: he shall grow as the lily, and cast forth his roots as Lebanon.
His*p branches shall spread, and his beauty shall be as the olive tree, and his smell as Lebanon.
They*p that dwell under his shadow shall return; they shall revive as the corn, and grow as the vine: the scent thereof shall be as the wine of Lebanon.
Ephraim*p shall say, What have I to do any more with idols? I have heard him, and observed him: I am like a green fir tree. From me is thy fruit found.
Who*p is wise, and he shall understand these things? prudent, and he shall know them? for the ways of the Lord*s are right, and the just shall walk in them: but the transgressors shall fall therein.
